Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: We need to capture The process begins with Receive Application RA then Validate Form VF then Assess Eligibility AE Possibly missing info and re validation loops The given event log shows that case 1 after AE theres a Request Missing Info RMI then Validate Form VF again before Approval Decision AD then Send Confirmation SC Archive Case AC Case 2 after AE goes straight to AD then SC AC No missing info Case 3 after AE we have two RMI events consecutively then Validate Form VF then AD SC AC

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Thus process tree should capture a loop after AE we have a loop where optionally you can either exit to AD or do RMI and VF then back to loop Specifically Sequence from RA to AE then loop

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: The loop operator is A is executed then either you exit the loop or you execute B and then A again this can happen several times until the loop is exited So after A you either exit to next or execute B then A again

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: We can design loop child A sequence of RMI VF maybe optional A Sequence children RMI VF B tau silent Then the loop semantics do A optionally do tau then A again So effectively repeated sequence of RMI VF any number of times final tree sequence RA VF AE loop RMI VF tau AD SC AC

Name: Validation - NE
Text: The loop nodes first child A is executed at least once That means loop always executes A at least once But in our scenario we have cases where there is no missing info at all ie exit straight from AE to AD

Name: Backtracking - PE
Text: We need a loop that can be executed zero times To simulate using XOR inside a loop or place the loop after AE but before AD using XOR with tau XOR tau skip loop or loop RMI VF

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Root Sequence children RA VF AE XOR child1 tau skip child2 Loop children A Sequence RMI VF B tau then AD SC AC

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - IND
Text: That balances fitness precision and simplicity optional repeating loop for missing information and re validation
